revised_title: Improving Sextant Accuracy: Dark Glass and Mirror Examination Techniques
tldr: The authors describe an apparatus used at Kew Observatory to examine and test the accuracy of dark glasses and mirrors of sextants. The instrument, consisting of a telescope, collimators, and a heliostat, allows for precise measurements of errors in the shades and mirrors, ensuring accurate observations. The authors' method has been adopted by the Kew Committee for marking and approving sextant components.
